roleset.name: cover with glass, glaze

example.name: Simple transitive
example.text: She also glassed the window next to the front door.
example.arg: the window next to the front door.

example.name: Same type
example.text: I-1 removed the rear-view mirror, and *PRO*-1 carefully glassed the window.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. VerbNet entry butter-9.9. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: to scan with binoculars

role.descr: Scanned for what? thing searched for

example.name: Simple transitive
example.text: When it was light enough to use binoculars he glassed the valley below.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: She glassed the country for the black of a moose.
example.arg: for the black of a moose

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. No appropriate VN entry found. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: become glass-like in appearance

example.name: With manner
example.text: She glassed over in a drugged haze.

example.name: Very different semantics
example.text: My clown fish's eye has glassed over.

example.name: Eyes glass over
example.text: My rage was such that my eyes simply glassed over.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. No appropriate VN entry found. Framed by Claire.
